attributes.action: Hold a general election & public vote on digital ID's.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the Labour party took office, it has failed to meet any of its mandates set out & is slowly implementing laws & acts set out to oppose freedom of speech. We are meant to be living in a free democratic society. The Labour Party does not represent this.

We want:

-An early general election with an additional public vote regarding the implementation on digital ID's. 

If the PM is so confident in his ability and decision making, call a general election, give the people what they want.
attributes.background: The public of the UK want a general election and public vote on digital ID's, much like the process we had taken during the Brexit Campaign. There is a clear divide within and outside or parliament which requires a vote, not a forced decision made by one person.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions, which call for the same action: 

"Hold a referendum on introducing mandatory identity cards in the UK" https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/734246

"Call an immediate general election" https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/727309
